newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar finishes weaker, but off lows.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar finishes weaker, but off lows.

text.p: London white sugar futures finished softer on Thursday evening, but fears over seasonal tightness lent a firm floor to the market, traders said.
August finished $1.70 easier at $326.70 per tonne, but off its low of $325.70. October closed $2.00 lower at $317.20.
The nearby arbitrage attracted commission house selling and profits were taken after funds built up long positions in the nearby months, traders said.
Mixed buying supported the market at the lower end of the ranges and analysts said the market's medium uptrend should be sustained.
"It's a pure correction," one trader said.
Chartists placed resistance at this week's high of $330.80 with a target of $341.00.
Volume was 2,624 lots, of which 1,315 lots were in the front month.
In Paris, August closed $1.50 down at $327.00 and October ended $2.00 lower at $317.50.
